basics.name: Pallavi Garg
basics.label: Graduate Student | Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hello! I am currently pursuing a Master of Computer Science degree at the University of California Irvine, expected to graduate in December 2023. With experience at Nagarro since 2015, I consistently deliver high-quality work within deadlines. Proficient in agile processes, design patterns, and coding standards, I excel in languages like C++, Python, and C#. I have a strong aptitude for learning and thrive in collaborative team environments.
basics.summary2: Outside of coding, I nurture a collection of over 100 house plants and enjoy leisurely walks. Driven by curiosity, I seek to expand my horizons through various projects. I am eager to contribute to groundbreaking advancements and make a meaningful impact in the field.
basics.contactme: Let's connect and collaborate! Feel free to contact me at pallavg1@uci.edu. Looking forward to connecting with you!

education.institution: Guru Nanak Dev University, Gurdaspur, India

work.company: Nagarro Software Pvt. Ltd., Gurugram, India
work.summary: Enhanced a commercial Lighting Design tool built with WPF and .Net technologies.
highlights: Improved responsiveness of application by moving image fetch logic to a background thread and designing a messaging framework update UI.
Reduced execution time of integration test cases by 30% by mocking SQL stored procedures and building an in-memory database.
Constructed a RESTful web service to automatically populate areas with devices as per building energy codes, making the process 20% faster.
Enhanced WPF TextBlock control to support formatted text and hyperlinks to reduce development time.
Wrote unit and functional test cases using frameworks such as MSTest and SpecFlow to improve code readability.
Organized “Know Your Software” and knowledge sharing sessions.
responsibilities: Follow Agile methodologies and participate in all project activities like project planning, task breakdown, effort estimation, retrospective meetings etc. alongside working with cross-functional teams
Offer insights and recommendations on technical design, architecture, and best practices.
Work on proof of concepts for new and high-risk features. Collaborate with architects and other stakeholders to design scalable and robust software solutions.
Work analyzing and resolving complex technical problems and challenges. Conduct root cause analysis and provide solutions or workarounds.
Make detailed design and Use Case diagrams for user stories using UML.

volunteer.organization: Nagarro Fresher Hiring and Training Group, Gurugram, India
highlights: Trained 9 junior software engineers in .Net technologies in-person and over Teams meetings.
Designed and graded coding assignments, providing feedback and discussion sessions.
